title: What element has 1 proton and 0 neutrons and electrons? - Quora

response.answer_text: That can only be the ion of the most common hydrogen isotope, H-1, or the protium ion. Deuterium, H-2, another stable hydrogen isotope, has one proton and one neutron in the nucleus. Tritium, H-3, is radioactive (unstable) and has one proton and two neutrons in the nucleus. In any case, the ions of these hydrogen isotopes are all designated as H+, but their individual atomic weights are different.
This sounds like a joke. If the electrons do not match the protons, it is not an atom and not an element, especially for a lone proton.
